intro: Blakea hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy blakea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Blakea hirsutissima is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
